page.title: 02Cadbury's of Bournville
page.content: In 1879{George Cadbury}moved his cocoa factory to its present site alongside the{Birmingham-Worcester Canal}and the {railway}linking Birmingham with London Bristol and Birkenhead, where it could have its own{wharfs and sidings}. The business expanded, producing a wide selection of chocolate products so that it is now Britain's{largest exporter}of chocolate.{Transport}of these goods is still aided by the site which is not only adjacent to the railway but lies on the{Outer Ring Road}, between the {A441 and the A38}which gives quick access to the{M5 and M6 Motorways.}Over the years the company has amalgamated with other companies, the most recent being the merger with Schweppes and Typhoo to form the{Cadbury-Schweppes Group}which produces a wide range of soft drinks, tea and biscuits, as well as their selection of confectionery.
